--- title: "The New Space Race" author: "Dan MacGuigan" date: "2024-02-22" categories: [python, visualization, GIS, politics, satellites] css: styles.css --- Recently, I listened to a [NY Times story](https://www.nytimes.com/2024/02/28/podcasts/the-daily/us-russia-space.html) about how the world is entering a new space race. The US, China, and Russia are all vying for military dominance and developing new weapons to target satellites. The story also touched on the increasing role of private companies in space. I was curious to see just how much satellite launches are accelerating. I found a few nice visualizations, like [this one](https://www.economist.com/graphic-detail/2018/10/18/the-space-race-is-dominated-by-new-contenders) from the Economist. However, I could not find any plots that showed launches up to the present day. So I figured let's make our own. For the data, we'll turn to [Jonathan's Space Report](https://planet4589.org/), a fantastic (and old school) website with a massive amount of data on the entire history of spaceflight. This website appears to be the passion project of Jonathan McDowell, a researcher at the Harvard-Smithsonian Center for Astrophysics. So thank you Jonathan! First, let's download and read in the data. ::: {.cell execution_count=1} ``` {.python .cell-code} import wget import pandas as pd # download database of launches url = 'https://planet4589.org/space/gcat/tsv/derived/launchlog.tsv' filename = wget.download(url) # read in tsv file to data frame launches = pd.read_table(filename, sep='\t') # we need to remove the first row, since it's not data launches = launches.drop(index=0) # examine data table launches.head() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=1} ```{=html}
#Launch_Tag Launch_Date Piece Type Name PLName JCAT SatOwner SatState LV_Type Flight_ID Platform Launch_Site Launch_Pad Ascent_Site Ascent_Pad Agency LVState Launch_Code LTCite
1 1957 ALP 1957 Oct 4 1928:34 1957 ALP 2 P 1-y ISZ PS-1 S00002 OKB1 SU Sputnik 8K71PS M1-PS - NIIP-5 LC1 - - MVS SU OS Energiya
2 1957 BET 1957 Nov 3 0230:42 1957 BET 1 P A 2-y ISZ PS-2 S00003 OKB1 SU Sputnik 8K71PS M1-2PS - NIIP-5 LC1 - - MVS SU OS Grahn-WWW
3 1957-F01 1957 Dec 6 1644:35 1957-F01 P F Vanguard Vanguard Test Satellite F F00002 NRL US Vanguard TV-3 - CC LC18A - - NRL US OF Vang-ER9948
4 1958 ALP 1958 Feb 1 0347:56 1958 ALP P A Explorer I Explorer 1 S00004 ABMA/JPLA US Jupiter C RS-29 UE - CC LC26A - - ABMA US OS JunoFam
5 1958-F01 1958 Feb 5 0733 1958-F01 P F Vanguard Vanguard Test Satellite G F00004 NRL US Vanguard TV-3BU - CC LC18A - - NRL US OF Vang-ER9955
